title: Why did Tarzaned get a 117 day ban and not a perm ban?
body: Why does he get special treatment just because he's high elo?

replies.body:
He did not get a 117 day ban.

The account was banned for intentional feeding, but the account was not his, so a protective ban was placed on the account.

It was likely the support agent just applied a random time-ban to note the intentional feeding case on the account, because they knew they were going to apply the protective suspension on top of it.
But normally you perm ban anyway and don't reverse it for hacked accounts...

> [{quoted}](name=Octavia,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=bAUEAwtK,comment-id=00070000,timestamp=2017-07-20T01:09:25.518+0000)
>
> But normally you perm ban anyway and don't reverse it for hacked accounts...

There have been many many threads where people have had shield bans and then they were instructed to go through the support tickets and had it resolved and they followed up on the forums letting people know the shield ban was lifted.

Many of the "hack" claims are actually false hack claims on the forums to try and get sympathy from the community to try and undo a ban because they claim a hack but in reality there was no hack.

There are TONS of liars on the forum and if you read the threads, you'll see a LOT of people get caught in their lies and then never post again.
